text: Jacob George Mye (3 December 1926 – 26 April 2012) was an elder statesman from the Torres Strait.Obituary, Cairns Funeral Directors. Accessed 26 March 2019. A vocal advocate of land and sea rights for Torres Strait Islanders, Mye is credited with helping the region gain autonomy from Queensland, with the formation of the Torres Strait Regional Authority in 1994.Caruana, Patrick (26 April 2012) Torres Strait elder George Mye dies, news.com.au, News Corp Australia. Retrieved 26 March 2019.(1 November 1976) Self-rule for islands sought, The Canberra Times. Retrieved 26 March 2019.(12 June 1987) Torres Strait people vote for succession, The Canberra Times. Retrieved 26 March 2019. Mye served as a commissioner with the Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Commission and was involved in local government in the Torres Strait for more than 20 years.Ryan, Brad (27 April 2012) Torres Strait elder dies, ABC News, Australian Broadcasting Corporation. Retrieved 26 March 2019. In recognition of Mye's work with the Torres Strait Islander community, he received numerous honours throughout his career, including an MBE in the 1979 New Year HonoursAward ID: 1086664, It's an Honour search facility, Department of the Prime Minister and Cabinet, Australian Government. Accessed 26 March 2019., an OAM in the 1994 Australia Day honoursAward ID: 873638, It's an Honour search facility, Department of the Prime Minister and Cabinet, Australian Government. Accessed 26 March 2019., a Male Elder of the Year Award at the 1998 NAIDOC Awards, and a Centenary of Federation Medal in 2001.Award ID: 1119225, It's an Honour search facility, Department of the Prime Minister and Cabinet, Australian Government. Accessed 26 March 2019. He also worked as a cultural consultant on the SBS drama series RAN Remote Area Nurse, which was filmed in the Torres Strait.Gallasch, Keith (February 2006) RAN: inter- cultural exploration, realtime, Issue 71. Retrieved 26 March 2019. Mye died from pneumonia on 26 April 2012. His death prompted tributes from political and community leaders including Queensland Premier Campbell Newman and Member for Leichhardt Warren Entsch.Newman, Campbell (26 April 2012) Statement from the Premier – Passing of Mr George Mye MBE OAM, Queensland Cabinet and Ministerial Directory, Queensland Government. Retrieved 28 March 2019. His funeral was held at All Saints Anglican Church on Darnley Island on 16 May 2012. Following his death, Mye was posthumously awarded an AM in the 2013 Australia Day Honours.Award ID: 1147268, It's an Honour search facility, Department of the Prime Minister and Cabinet, Australian Government. Accessed 26 March 2019. == References == Category:1926 births Category:2012 deaths Category:Australian indigenous rights activists Category:Members of the Order of Australia Category:Recipients of the Medal of the Order of Australia Category:Australian Members of the Order of the British Empire
title: George Mye
